Newmont Corporation (NYSE&#58; NEM, ASX&#58; NEM, TSX&#58; NGT, PNGX&#58; NEM) (Newmont or the Company) today announced second quarter 2024 results and declared a second quarter dividend of $0.25 per share.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:12pt"><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">&#34;Newmont delivered a solid second quarter, producing 2.1 million gold equivalent ounces and generating $594 million in free cash flow,&#34; said Tom Palmer, Newmont's President and Chief Executive Officer. &#34;We continued to advance our divestiture program and, to date, have announced $527 million in proceeds this year. With this momentum, we completed $250 million in share repurchases and repaid $250 million in debt. As we head into the second half of the year, we remain confident in our ability to continue executing on shareholder returns, meet our full year guidance and deliver on our commitments.&#34;</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:3pt;margin-top:18pt"><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Q2 2024 </font></div><div style="padding-left:36pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">&#9642;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.55pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%;position:relative;top:-2.44pt;vertical-align:baseline">3</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%"> Newmont's Board of Directors declared a dividend of $0.25 per share of common stock for the second quarter of 2024, payable on September 30, 2024 to holders of record at the close of business on September 5, 2024.</font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.55pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%;position:relative;top:-2.44pt;vertical-align:baseline">4</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%"> Gold equivalent ounces (GEOs) calculated using Gold ($1,400&#47;oz.), Copper ($3.50&#47;lb.), Silver ($20.00&#47;oz.), Lead ($1.00&#47;lb.) and Zinc ($1.20&#47;lb.) pricing for 2024.</font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.55pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%;position:relative;top:-2.44pt;vertical-align:baseline">5</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%"> Newmont&#8217;s go-forward portfolio is focused on Tier 1 assets, consisting of (1) six managed Tier 1 assets (Boddington, Tanami, Cadia, Lihir, Pe&#241;asquito and Ahafo), (2) assets owned through two non-managed joint ventures at Nevada Gold Mines and Pueblo Viejo, including four Tier 1 assets (Carlin, Cortez, Turquoise Ridge and Pueblo Viejo), (3) three emerging Tier 1 assets (Merian, Cerro Negro and Yanacocha), which do not currently meet the criteria for Tier 1 Asset, and (4) an emerging Tier 1 district in the Golden Triangle in British Columbia (Red Chris and Brucejack), which does not currently meet the criteria for Tier 1 Asset. Newmont&#8217;s Tier 1 portfolio also includes attributable production from the Company&#8217;s equity interest in Lundin Gold (Fruta del Norte). Tier 1 Portfolio cost and capital metrics include the proportional share of the Company&#8217;s interest in the Nevada Gold Mines joint venture.</font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.55pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%;position:relative;top:-2.44pt;vertical-align:baseline">6 </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">Non-GAAP metrics&#59; see reconciliations at the end of this release.</font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.55pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%;position:relative;top:-2.44pt;vertical-align:baseline">7</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%"> Synergies are a management estimate provided for illustrative purposes and should not be considered a GAAP or non-GAAP financial measure. Synergies represent management&#8217;s combined estimate of pre-tax synergies, supply chain efficiencies and Full Potential improvements, as a result of the integration of Newmont&#8217;s and Newcrest&#8217;s businesses that have been monetized for the purposes of the estimation. Such estimates are necessarily imprecise and are based on numerous judgments and assumptions. See cautionary statement at the end of this release regarding forward-looking statements.</font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.55pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%;position:relative;top:-2.44pt;vertical-align:baseline">8</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%"> See discussion of outlook and cautionary statement at the end of this release regarding forward-looking statements.</font></div><div style="height:36pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="margin-top:2pt"><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">NEWMONT SECOND</font><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:700;line-height:115%"> </font><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">QUARTER 2024 RESULTS &#124; NEWS RELEASE       &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;1</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font></div><div><font><br></font></div></div></div><div id="i0e00af663a664c54913cb3141a734b2f_4"></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:99pt;width:100%"><div><img alt="image.jpg" src="image.jpg" style="height:98px;margin-bottom:5pt;vertical-align:text-bottom;width:818px"></div></div><div style="margin-top:11pt"><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:700;line-height:115%">Advancing Portfolio Optimization with Monetization of Batu Hijau Deferred Payment Rights</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Newmont today announced it has entered into an agreement to sell 100 percent of the entity holding Newmont's deferred payment rights associated with the Batu Hijau copper and gold mine in Indonesia for total consideration of $153 million in cash, with closing to occur no later than September 30, 2024. Furthermore, an additional $10 million cash payment associated with these deferred payment rights was received in July. During the second quarter of 2024, Newmont also received a $34 million cash payment, bringing total proceeds to $197 million for 2024.</font></div><div><font><br></font></div><div><font 0;text-align:right;vertical-align:bottom"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">520&#160;</font></td><td style="background-color:#d9e8ec;border-bottom:0.5pt solid #0c2b82;border-top:0.5pt solid #0c2b82;padding:2px 1pt 2px 0;text-align:right;vertical-align:bottom"></td></tr></table></div><div style="margin-top:10pt"><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">SECOND QUARTER 2024 PRODUCTION AND FINANCIAL SUMMARY</font></div><div style="margin-top:8pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:115%">Attributable gold production</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.85pt;font-weight:700;line-height:115%;position:relative;top:-3.15pt;vertical-align:baseline">1</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%"> decreased 4 percent to 1,607 thousand ounces from the prior quarter primarily due to lower production at Cerro Negro as a result of the suspension of operations during the quarter following the tragic fatalities of two members of the Newmont workforce on April 9, 2024. Operations at Cerro Negro safely resumed on May 24, 2024. In addition, operations were suspended as of April 14, 2024 at Telfer, one of Newmont's non-core assets, as further work is completed to remediate the safe operation of the tailings storage facility. Second quarter production was also impacted by lower production at Lihir due to heavy rainfall impacting mine sequencing, as well as lower production at Akyem due to lower grades as a result of the ongoing stripping campaign. These impacts were partially offset by higher production at Porcupine, Brucejack and Pe&#241;asquito.</font></div><div><font><br></font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">Full year production for 2024 is expected to be second-half weighted as previously indicated, with a sequential increase weighted towards the fourth quarter. The second-half weighting is expected to be driven primarily by improved grades at Pe&#241;asquito, Ahafo and Tanami, improved throughput from Lihir and Boddington and sequential improvements delivered from our non-managed joint venture operations.</font></div><div style="margin-top:8pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Average realized gold price</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> was $2,347, an increase of $257 per ounce over the prior quarter. Average realized gold price includes $2,344 per ounce of gross price received, a favorable impact of $17 per ounce mark-to-market on provisionally-priced sales and reductions of $14 per ounce for treatment and refining charges.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Gold CAS</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.85pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-3.15pt;vertical-align:baseline">2</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> totaled $1.8 billion for the quarter.</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%"> Gold CAS per ounce</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.85pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-3.15pt;vertical-align:baseline">3</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> increased 9 percent to $1,152 per ounce compared to the prior quarter primarily due to lower sales volumes, processing of stockpiles at Porcupine and Tanami and higher third party royalties as a result of higher gold prices.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Gold AISC per ounce</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.85pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-3.15pt;vertical-align:baseline">3</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> increased 9 percent to $1,562 per ounce compared to the prior quarter primarily due to higher CAS and higher sustaining capital spend.</font></div><div style="height:36pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="margin-top:2pt"><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">NEWMONT SECOND</font><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:700;line-height:115%"> </font><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">QUARTER 2024 RESULTS &#124; NEWS RELEASE       &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;2</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font></div><div><font><br></font></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:99pt;width:100%"><div><img alt="image.jpg" src="image.jpg" style="height:98px;margin-bottom:5pt;vertical-align:text-bottom;width:818px"></div></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Attributable gold equivalent ounce (GEO) production from other metals</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> was largely in line with the prior quarter at 477 thousand ounces.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">CAS from other metals</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.85pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-3.15pt;vertical-align:baseline">2</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> totaled $379 million for the quarter. </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">CAS per GEO</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.85pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-3.15pt;vertical-align:baseline">3</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> was largely in line with the prior quarter at $836 per ounce.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">AISC per GEO</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.85pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-3.15pt;vertical-align:baseline">3</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> increased 5 percent to $1,207 per ounce compared to the prior quarter primarily due to higher sustaining capital spend.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Net income from continuing operations attributable to Newmont stockholders </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">was $838 million or $0.73 per diluted share, an increase of $672 million from the prior quarter primarily due to the loss on assets held for sale of $485 million recognized during the first quarter of 2024, as well as higher average realized prices for all metals in the second quarter of 2024.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Adjusted net income</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.85pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-3.15pt;vertical-align:baseline">4</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%"> </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">was $834 million or $0.72 per diluted share, compared to $630 million or $0.55 per diluted share in the prior quarter. Primary adjustments to second quarter net income include a loss on assets held for sale of $246 million, a gain on asset and investment sales of $55 million primarily related to the previously announced sale of the Lundin Stream Credit Facility Agreement and the purchase and sale of foreign currency bonds</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.85pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-3.15pt;vertical-align:baseline">8</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">, a gain of $14 million on the partial redemption of certain Senior notes, and Newcrest transaction and integration costs of $16 million. </font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Adjusted EBITDA</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.85pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-3.15pt;vertical-align:baseline">4</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> increased 16 percent to $2.0 billion for the quarter, compared to $1.7 billion for the prior quarter. </font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Consolidated cash from operations before working capital</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.85pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-3.15pt;vertical-align:baseline">5</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> increased 15 percent from the prior quarter to $1.7 billion primarily due to higher realized prices for all metals in the second quarter.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Consolidated net cash from operating activities</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> increased 80 percent from the prior quarter to $1.4 billion primarily due to the improvement in cash from operations. Net cash from operating activities in the second quarter was impacted by a $263 million reduction in operating cash flow due to changes in working capital, including a build in inventories, stockpiles and ore on leach pads of $185 million and reclamation spend of $107 million, primarily related to the construction of the Yanacocha water treatment facilities.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Free Cash Flow</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.85pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-3.15pt;vertical-align:baseline">7 </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">was $594 million compared to $(74) million in the prior quarter primarily due to improvements in consolidated net cash from operating activities, partially offset by higher capital expenditures before capital accruals.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Capital expenditures (net of capital accruals)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.85pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-3.15pt;vertical-align:baseline">6</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> decreased 6 percent from the prior quarter to $800 million primarily due to an increase of capital accruals offsetting higher sustaining and development capital expenditures. Sustaining capital spend increased from the first quarter due to the ramp-up of spend on the tailings project at Cadia and the purchase of updated fleet equipment at Merian. Development capital expenditures in 2024 primarily relate to Tanami Expansion 2, Ahafo North, Cadia Block Caves and Cerro Negro expansion projects.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Balance sheet and liquidity </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">remained strong in the second quarter, ending the quarter with $2.6 billion of consolidated cash, cash of $205 million included in</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> Assets held for sale</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> and time deposits of $28 million, with approximately $6.8 billion of total liquidity&#59; reported net debt to pro forma adjusted EBITDA of 1.0x</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.85pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-3.15pt;vertical-align:baseline">9</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">.</font></div><div style="margin-top:12pt"><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">NON-MANAGED JOINT VENTURE AND EQUITY METHOD INVESTMENTS</font><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.85pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-3.15pt;vertical-align:baseline">10</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Nevada Gold Mines (NGM) </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">attributable gold production decreased 4 percent to 253 thousand ounces, with a 4 percent increase in CAS to $1,220 per ounce</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.85pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-3.15pt;vertical-align:baseline">3</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> and a 7 percent increase in AISC to $1,689 per ounce</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.85pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-3.15pt;vertical-align:baseline">3</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> compared to the prior quarter. </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Pueblo Viejo (PV) </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">attributable gold production decreased 2 percent to 53 thousand ounces compared to the prior quarter. Cash distributions received for the Company's equity method investment in Pueblo Viejo totaled $12 million in the second quarter. Capital contributions of $5 million were made during the quarter related to the expansion project at Pueblo Viejo.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Fruta del Norte </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">attributable gold production is reported on a quarter lag. Production reported in the second quarter of 2024 increased 67 percent to 35 thousand ounces compared to the prior quarter. Cash distributions received from the Company's equity method investment in Fruta del Norte were $8 million for the second quarter.</font></div><div><table style="border-collapse:collapse;display:inline-table;margin-bottom:5pt;vertical-align:text-bottom;width:37.083%"><tr><td style="width:1.0%"></td><td style="width:98.900%"></td><td style="width:0.1%"></td></tr><tr style="height:3pt"><td colspan="3" style="border-top:1pt solid #000;padding:0 1pt"></td></tr></table></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.55pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%;position:relative;top:-2.44pt;vertical-align:baseline">1</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%"> Attributable gold production includes ounces from the Company's equity method investment in Pueblo Viejo (40%) and in Lundin Gold (32.0%).</font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.55pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%;position:relative;top:-2.44pt;vertical-align:baseline">2</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%"> </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">Consolidated Costs applicable to sales (CAS) excludes Depreciation and amortization and Reclamation and remediation.</font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.55pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%;position:relative;top:-2.44pt;vertical-align:baseline">3</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%"> Non-GAAP measure. See end of this release for reconciliation to Costs applicable to sales.</font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.55pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%;position:relative;top:-2.44pt;vertical-align:baseline">4</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%"> Non-GAAP measure. See end of this release for reconciliation to Net income (loss) attributable to Newmont stockholders.</font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.55pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%;position:relative;top:-2.44pt;vertical-align:baseline">5</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%"> Cash from operations before working capital is a non-GAAP metric with the most directly comparable GAAP financial metric being to Net cash provided by (used in) operating activities, as shown reconciled in the Condensed Consolidated Statements of Cash Flows.</font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.55pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%;position:relative;top:-2.44pt;vertical-align:baseline">6</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%"> Capital expenditures refers to Additions to property plant and mine development from the Consolidated Statements of Cash Flows.</font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.55pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%;position:relative;top:-2.44pt;vertical-align:baseline">7</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%"> Non-GAAP measure. See end of this release for reconciliation to Net cash provided by operating activities. </font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.55pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%;position:relative;top:-2.44pt;vertical-align:baseline">8</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%"> In June 2024, the Company entered into AUD and CAD denominated fixed forward contracts to mitigate variability in the USD functional cash flows related to capital and operating expenditures for certain development projects and mines in Australia and Canada.</font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.55pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%;position:relative;top:-2.44pt;vertical-align:baseline">9</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%"> Non-GAAP measure. See end of this release for reconciliation.</font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.55pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%;position:relative;top:-2.44pt;vertical-align:baseline">10</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%"> Newmont has a 38.5% interest in Nevada Gold Mines, which is accounted for using the proportionate consolidation method. In addition, Newmont has a 40% interest in Pueblo Viejo, which is accounted for as an equity method investment, as well as a 32.0% interest in Lundin Gold, who wholly owns and operates the Fruta del Norte mine, which is accounted for as an equity method investment on a quarter lag.</font></div><div style="height:36pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="margin-top:2pt"><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">NEWMONT SECOND</font><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:700;line-height:115%"> </font><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">QUARTER 2024 RESULTS &#124; NEWS RELEASE       &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;3</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font></div><div><font><br></font></div></div></div><div id="i0e00af663a664c54913cb3141a734b2f_7"></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:99pt;width:100%"><div><img alt="image.jpg" src="image.jpg" style="height:98px;margin-bottom:5pt;vertical-align:text-bottom;width:818px"></div></div><div style="margin-bottom:8pt;margin-top:12pt"><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:700;line-height:115%">Committed to Concurrent Reclamation </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Since mines operate for a finite period, careful closure planning is crucial to address the diverse social, economic, environmental and regulatory impacts associated with the end of mining operations. Newmont&#8217;s global Closure Strategy integrates closure planning throughout each operation&#8217;s lifespan, aiming to create enduring positive and sustainable legacies that last long after mining ceases. Newmont continues to accrue to reclamation and remediation spend through the year. Newmont expects to incur a cash outflow of approximately $600 million in 2024 and $700 million in 2025, primarily related to the construction of two new water treatment plants and post-closure management at Yanacocha. The operation&#8217;s ongoing closure planning study advanced to the feasibility state in December 2023 and continues to address several complex closure issues, including water management, social impacts and tailings. A long-term water management solution will replace five existing water treatment facilities with two, addressing the watersheds along the continental divide. Certain estimated costs remain subject to revision as ongoing study work and assessment of opportunities that incorporates the latest design considerations remain in progress. </font></div><div style="height:36pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="margin-top:2pt"><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">NEWMONT SECOND</font><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:700;line-height:115%"> </font><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">QUARTER 2024 RESULTS &#124; NEWS RELEASE       &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;4</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font></div><div><font><br></font></div></div></div><div id="i0e00af663a664c54913cb3141a734b2f_10"></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:99pt;width:100%"><div><img alt="image.jpg" src="image.jpg" style="height:98px;margin-bottom:5pt;vertical-align:text-bottom;width:818px"></div></div><div style="margin-top:2pt"><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:700;line-height:115%">Newmont's 2024 Outlook</font></div><div style="margin-top:3pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">For a more detailed discussion, see the Company&#8217;s 2024 Outlook released on February 22, 2024, available on Newmont.com. Please see the cautionary statement and footnotes for additional information.</font></div><div><table style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">34%</font></td></tr></table></div><div style="margin-top:3pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.55pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-2.44pt;vertical-align:baseline">a</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Co-product metal pricing assumptions in imperial units equate to Copper ($4.00&#47;lb.), Lead ($1.00&#47;lb.) and Zinc ($1.35&#47;lb.).</font></div><div><font style="background-color:#ffffff;color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.55pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-2.44pt;vertical-align:baseline">b</font><font style="background-color:#ffffff;color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Consolidated basis</font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.55pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-2.44pt;vertical-align:baseline">c</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> The adjusted tax rate excludes certain items such as tax valuation allowance adjustments. </font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.55pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-2.44pt;vertical-align:baseline">d</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> Assuming average prices of $1,900 per ounce for gold, $4.00 per pound for copper, $23.00 per ounce for silver, $1.00 per pound for lead, and $1.35 per pound for zinc and achievement of production, sales and cost estimates, Newmont estimates its consolidated adjusted effective tax rate related to continuing operations for 2024 will be 34%.</font></div><div style="height:36pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="margin-top:2pt"><font 0;text-align:right;vertical-align:middle"></td></tr></table></div><div style="padding-left:9pt;text-indent:-9pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.87pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-2.62pt;vertical-align:baseline">(1)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:3.34pt">Attributable gold ounces sold excludes ounces related to the Pueblo Viejo mine, which is 40% owned by Newmont and accounted for as an equity method investment, and the Fruta del Norte mine, which is wholly owned by Lundin Gold whom the Company holds a 32.0% interest and is accounted for as an equity method investment. </font></div><div style="padding-left:9pt;text-indent:-9pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.87pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-2.62pt;vertical-align:baseline">(2)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:3.34pt">For the three months ended June 30, 2023 and September 30, 2023, Pe&#241;asquito production was impacted due to the suspension of operations as a result of the Union labor strike. Sales activity recognized in the third quarter of 2023 was related to adjustments on provisionally price concentrate sales subject to final settlement. Consequently, price per ounce&#47;pound metrics are not meaningful (&#34;N.M&#34;).</font></div><div style="padding-left:9pt;text-indent:-9pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.87pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-2.62pt;vertical-align:baseline">(3)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:3.34pt">Represents attributable gold from Newmont's 40% interest in Pueblo Viejo, which is accounted for as an equity method investment. Attributable gold ounces produced at Pueblo Viejo are not included in attributable gold ounces sold, as noted in footnote (1). Income and expenses of equity method investments are included in </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Equity income (loss) of affiliates</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">. </font></div><div style="padding-left:9pt;text-indent:-9pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.87pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-2.62pt;vertical-align:baseline">(4)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:3.34pt">Represents attributable gold from Newmont's 32.0% interest in Lundin Gold, who wholly owns and operates the Fruta del Norte mine, which is accounted for on a quarterly-lag as an equity method investment. Attributable gold ounces produced by Lundin Gold represent prior quarter production and are not included in attributable gold ounces sold, as noted in footnote (1). Income and expenses of equity method investments are included in </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Equity income (loss) of affiliates</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">. </font></div><div style="padding-left:9pt;text-indent:-9pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.87pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-2.62pt;vertical-align:baseline">(5)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:3.34pt">Sites are classified as held for sale as of June 30, 2024. </font></div><div style="padding-left:9pt;text-indent:-9pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.87pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-2.62pt;vertical-align:baseline">(6)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:3.34pt">Non-GAAP measure. See end of this release for reconciliation.</font></div><div style="height:36pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="margin-top:2pt"><font presentation.</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.22pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-2.27pt;vertical-align:baseline">(2)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:6.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:13.09pt">Cash from operations before working capital is a non-GAAP metric with the most directly comparable GAAP financial metric being to </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:6.5pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Net cash provided by (used in) operating activities</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:6.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">, as shown reconciled above.</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.22pt;font-weight:400;line-height:105%;position:relative;top:-2.27pt;vertical-align:baseline">(3)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:6.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:105%;padding-left:13.09pt">During the first quarter of 2024, certain non-core assets were determined to meet the criteria for assets held for sale. As a result, the related assets and liabilities, including $205 of </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:6.5pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:105%">Cash and cash equivalents</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:6.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:105%"> and $53 of restricted cash, included in </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:6.5pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:105%">ssets held for sale</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open style="padding-left:18pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.87pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-2.62pt;vertical-align:baseline">(10)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Reclamation and remediation</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">, represent revisions to reclamation and remediation plans at the Company's former operating properties and historic mining operations that have entered the closure phase and have no substantive future economic value. </font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.87pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-2.62pt;vertical-align:baseline">(11)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:9.56pt">The tax effect of adjustments, included in </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Income and mining tax benefit (expense)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">, represents the tax effect of adjustments in footnotes (2) through (10), as described above, and are calculated using the applicable regional tax rate.</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.87pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-2.62pt;vertical-align:baseline">(12)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:9.56pt">Valuation allowance and other tax adjustments, included in </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Income and mining tax benefit (expense)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">, is recorded for items such as foreign tax credits, capital losses, disallowed foreign losses, and the effects of changes in foreign currency exchange rates on deferred tax assets and deferred tax liabilities. The adjustment for the three and six months ended June&#160;30, 2024 reflects the net increase or (decrease) to net operating losses, capital losses, tax credit carryovers, and other deferred tax assets subject to valuation allowance of $20 and $(45), the effects of changes in foreign exchange rates on deferred tax assets and liabilities of $(93) and $(58), net reductions to the reserve for uncertain tax positions of $(50) and $(52), recording of a deferred tax liability for the outside basis difference at Akyem of $(37) and $80 due to the status change to held-for-sale, and other tax adjustments of $18 and $25. </font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.87pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-2.62pt;vertical-align:baseline">(13)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:9.56pt">Adjusted net income (loss) per diluted share is calculated using diluted common shares in accordance with GAAP.</font></div><div style="height:36pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="margin-top:2pt"><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open style="padding-left:18pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:12.34pt">Restructuring and severance, included in </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Other expense, net</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">, primarily represents severance and related costs associated with significant organizational or operating model changes implemented by the Company.</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.87pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-2.62pt;vertical-align:baseline">(5)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:12.34pt">Impairment charges, included in </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Other expense, net</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">, represents non-cash write-downs of various assets that are no longer in use and materials and supplies inventories.</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.87pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-2.62pt;vertical-align:baseline">(6)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:12.34pt">Reclamation and remediation charges, included in </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Reclamation and remediation</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">, represent revisions to reclamation and remediation plans at the Company's former operating properties and historic mining operations that have entered the closure phase and have no substantive future economic value.</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.87pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-2.62pt;vertical-align:baseline">(7)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:12.34pt">Change in fair value of investments, included in </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Other income (loss), net</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">, primarily represents unrealized gains and losses related to the Company's investment in current and non-current marketable equity securities. </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt;padding-left:18pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.87pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-2.62pt;vertical-align:baseline">(8)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:12.34pt">Other represents income received on the favorable settlement of certain matters that were outstanding at the time of sale of the related investment in 2022. Amounts included in </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Other income (loss), net</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt;padding-left:18pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.87pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-2.62pt;vertical-align:baseline">(9)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:12.34pt">The tax effect of adjustments, included in </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Income and mining tax benefit (expense)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">, represents the tax effect of adjustments in footnotes (2) through (8), as described above, and are calculated using the applicable regional tax rate.</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.87pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-2.62pt;vertical-align:baseline">(10)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:9.56pt">Valuation allowance and other tax adjustments, included in </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Income and mining tax benefit (expense)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">, is recorded for items such as foreign tax credits, capital losses, disallowed foreign losses, and the effects of changes in foreign currency exchange rates on deferred tax assets and deferred tax liabilities. The adjustment for the three and six months ended June 30, 2023 reflects the net increase or (decrease) to net operating losses, capital losses, tax credit carryovers, and other deferred tax assets subject to valuation allowance of $47 and $57, the effects of changes in foreign exchange rates on deferred tax assets and liabilities of $4 and $21, net reductions to the reserve for uncertain tax positions of $3 and $14, other tax adjustments of $1 and $3.</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.87pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-2.62pt;vertical-align:baseline">(11)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:9.56pt">Adjusted net income (loss) per diluted share is calculated using diluted common shares in accordance with GAAP.</font></div><div><font><br></font></div><div style="height:36pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="margin-top:2pt"><font style="margin-top:2pt;padding-left:18pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.2pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-2.8pt;vertical-align:baseline">(1)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:11.97pt">Includes payment of $291 for stamp duty tax, related to the Newcrest transaction, in the first quarter of 2024.</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.2pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-2.8pt;vertical-align:baseline">(2)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:11.97pt">Net cash provided by (used in) investing activities </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">includes</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> Additions to property, plant and mine development,</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> which is included in the Company&#8217;s computation of Free Cash Flow.</font></div><div style="height:36pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="margin-top:2pt"><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">NEWMONT SECOND</font><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:700;line-height:115%"> </font><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">QUARTER 2024 RESULTS &#124; NEWS RELEASE       &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;14</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font></div><div><font><br></font></div></div></div><div id="i0e00af663a664c54913cb3141a734b2f_40"></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:36pt;width:100%"><div style="padding-left:18pt"><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-bottom:12pt;margin-top:12pt;padding-left:18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Attributable Free Cash Flow</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Management uses Attributable Free Cash Flow as a non-GAAP measure to analyze cash flows generated from operations that are attributable to the Company. Attributable Free Cash Flow is </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Net cash provided by (used in) operating activities</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> after deducting net cash flows from operations attributable to noncontrolling interests less </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Net cash provided by (used in) operating activities of discontinued operations</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> after deducting net cash flows from discontinued operations attributable to noncontrolling interests less </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Additions to property, plant and mine development</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> after deducting property, plant and mine development attributable to noncontrolling interests. The Company believes that Attributable Free Cash Flow is useful as one of the bases for comparing the Company&#8217;s performance with its competitors. Although Attributable Free Cash Flow and similar measures are frequently used as measures of cash flows generated from operations by other companies, the Company&#8217;s calculation of Attributable Free Cash Flow is not necessarily comparable to such other similarly titled captions of other companies.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:9pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">The presentation of non-GAAP Attributable Free Cash Flow is not meant to be considered in isolation or as an alternative to Net income attributable to Newmont stockholders as an indicator of the Company&#8217;s performance, or as an alternative to </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Net cash provided by (used in) operating activities</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> as a measure of liquidity as those terms are defined by GAAP, and does not necessarily indicate whether cash flows will be sufficient to fund cash needs. The Company&#8217;s definition of Attributable Free Cash Flow is limited in that it does not represent residual cash flows available for discretionary expenditures due to the fact that the measure does not deduct the payments required for debt service and other contractual obligations or payments made for business acquisitions. Therefore, the Company believes it is important to view Attributable Free Cash Flow as a measure that provides supplemental information to the Company&#8217;s Condensed Consolidated Statements of Cash Flows.</font></div><div style="margin-top:9pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">The following tables set forth a reconciliation of Attributable Free Cash Flow, a non-GAAP financial measure, to </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Net cash provided by (used in) operating activities</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">, which the Company believes to be the GAAP financial measure most directly comparable to Attributable Free Cash Flow, as well as information regarding </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Net cash provided by (used in) investing activities</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> and </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Net cash provided by (used in) financing activities.</font></div><div style="text-indent:36pt"><table style="border-collapse:collapse;display:inline-table;margin-bottom:5pt;vertical-align:text-bottom;width:100.000%"><tr><td style="width:1.0%"></td><td style="width:32.788%"></td><td price to the gold price, using Gold ($1,400&#47;oz.), Copper ($3.50&#47;lb.), Silver ($20.00&#47;oz.), Lead ($1.00&#47;lb.) and Zinc ($1.20&#47;lb.) for each of 2024 and 2023.</font></div><div style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">All-In Sustaining Costs </font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">All-in sustaining costs represent the sum of certain costs, recognized as GAAP financial measures, that management considers to be associated with production. million ounces of silver, 20 thousand tonnes of lead and 52 thousand tonnes of zinc, Boddington sold 9 thousand tonnes of copper, Cadia sold 23 thousand tonnes of copper, and Telfer sold 1 thousand facility at Telfer and we have temporarily ceased placing new tailings on the facility. Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:9.56pt">Gold equivalent ounces is calculated as pounds or ounces produced multiplied by the ratio of the other metals price to the gold price, using Gold ($1,400&#47;oz.), Copper ($3.50&#47;lb.), Silver ($20.00&#47;oz.), Lead ($1.00&#47;lb.) and Zinc ($1.20&#47;lb.) pricing for 2023.</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.87pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-2.62pt;vertical-align:baseline">(13)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:9.56pt">For the three months ended June 30, 2023, Pe&#241;asquito sold 6 million ounces of silver, 16 thousand tonnes of lead and 41 thousand tonnes of zinc, and Boddington sold 11 thousand tonnes of copper.</font></div><div style="height:36pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:9.56pt">Corporate and Other includes the Company's business activities relating to its corporate and regional offices and all equity method investments.</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.87pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-2.62pt;vertical-align:baseline">(12)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:9.56pt">Sites are classified as held for sale as of June&#160;30, 2024.</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.87pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-2.62pt;vertical-align:baseline">(13)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:9.56pt">Gold equivalent ounces is calculated as pounds or ounces produced multiplied by the ratio of the other metals price to the gold price, using Gold ($1,400&#47;oz.), Copper ($3.50&#47;lb.), Silver ($20.00&#47;oz.), Lead ($1.00&#47;lb.) and Zinc ($1.20&#47;lb.) pricing for 2024.</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.87pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-2.62pt;vertical-align:baseline">(14)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:9.56pt">For the six months ended June 30, 2024, Red Chris sold 12 thousand tonnes of copper, Pe&#241;asquito sold 18 million ounces of silver, 49 thousand tonnes of lead and 113 thousand tonnes of zinc, Boddington sold 18 thousand tonnes of copper, Cadia sold 43 thousand tonnes of copper, and Telfer sold 2 thousand tonnes of copper.</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.87pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-2.62pt;vertical-align:baseline">(15)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:9.56pt">During the second quarter, seepage points were detected on the outer wall and around the tailings storage facility at Telfer and we have temporarily ceased placing new tailings on the facility. Remediation of the facility has commenced and we expect production to commence during the fourth quarter of 2024.</font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> </font></div><div style="height:36pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:12.34pt">The reconciliation is provided for illustrative purposes in order to better describe management&#8217;s estimates of the components of the calculation. Estimates for each component of the forward-looking All-in sustaining costs per ounce are independently calculated and, as a result, the total All-in sustaining costs and the All-in sustaining costs per ounce may not sum to the component ranges. While a reconciliation to the most directly comparable GAAP measure has been provided for the 2024 AISC Gold Outlook on a consolidated basis, a reconciliation has not been provided on an individual site or project basis in reliance on Item 10(e)(1)(i)(B) of Regulation S-K because such reconciliation is not available without unreasonable efforts.</font></div><div style="height:36pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="margin-top:2pt"><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">NEWMONT SECOND</font><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:700;line-height:115%"> </font><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">QUARTER 2024 RESULTS &#124; NEWS RELEASE       &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;22</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font></div><div><font><br></font></div></div></div><div id="i0e00af663a664c54913cb3141a734b2f_55"></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:36pt;width:100%"><div><font><br></font></div></div><div style="padding-left:18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Net debt to Adjusted EBITDA ratio</font></div><div style="margin-top:12pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Management uses net debt to Adjusted EBITDA as non-GAAP measures to evaluate the Company&#8217;s operating performance, including our ability to generate earnings sufficient to service our debt. Net debt to Adjusted EBITDA represents the ratio of the Company&#8217;s debt, net of cash and cash equivalents, to Adjusted EBITDA. Net debt to Adjusted EBITDA does not represent, and should not be considered an alternative to, net income (loss), operating income (loss), or cash flow from operations as those terms are defined by GAAP, and does not necessarily indicate whether cash flows will be sufficient to fund cash needs. Although Net Debt to Adjusted EBITDA&#160;and similar measures are frequently used as measures of operations and the ability to meet debt service requirements by other companies, our calculation of net debt to Adjusted EBITDA measure is not necessarily comparable to such other similarly titled captions of other companies. The Company believes that net debt to Adjusted EBITDA provides useful information to investors and others in understanding and evaluating our operating results in the same manner as our management and Board of Directors. Management&#8217;s determination of the components of net debt to Adjusted EBITDA is evaluated periodically and based, in part, on a review of non-GAAP financial measures used by mining industry analysts. Net income (loss) attributable to Newmont stockholders is reconciled to Adjusted EBITDA as follows&#58;</font></div><div style="margin-top:12pt"><table Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.87pt;font-weight:400;line-height:107%;position:relative;top:-2.62pt;vertical-align:baseline">(1)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:107%;padding-left:3.34pt">Represents Newcrest&#8217;s pre-acquisition Adjusted EBITDA on a US GAAP basis from January 1, 2023 through to the acquisition date, November 6, 2023. This amount is added to our adjusted EBITDA to include a full twelve months of Newcrest results on a pro forma basis for the rolling twelve months ended June 30, 2024. The pro forma adjusted EBITDA was derived from Newcrest unaudited financial information for the period July 1, 2023 through October 31, 2023 and November 1, 2023 through November 6, 2023, the acquisition date. Newcrest&#8217;s pre-acquisition Adjusted EBITDA has been added to our adjusted EBITDA for the purposes of Net Debt to Pro Forma Adjusted EBITDA ratio only.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt;padding-left:9pt;text-indent:-9pt"><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.87pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-2.62pt;vertical-align:baseline">(2)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:3.34pt">During the first quarter of 2024, certain non-core assets were determined to meet the criteria for assets held for sale. As a result, the related assets and liabilities, including $205 of </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Cash and cash equivalents</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">, were reclassified to </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Assets held for sale</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> and </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Liabilities held for sale</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">, respectively. </font></div><div style="padding-left:9pt;text-indent:-9pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.87pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-2.62pt;vertical-align:baseline">(3)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> on the Condensed Consolidated Balance Sheets. </font></div><div style="height:36pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="margin-top:2pt"><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">NEWMONT SECOND</font><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:700;line-height:115%"> </font><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">QUARTER 2024 RESULTS &#124; NEWS RELEASE       &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;23</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font></div><div><font><br></font></div></div></div><div id="i0e00af663a664c54913cb3141a734b2f_58"></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:36pt;width:100%"><div><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-top:12pt;padding-left:18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Net average realized price per ounce&#47; pound</font></div><div style="margin-top:12pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Average realized price per ounce&#47; pound are non-GAAP financial measures. The measures are calculated by dividing the net consolidated gold, copper, silver, lead and zinc sales by the consolidated gold ounces, copper pounds, silver ounces, lead pounds and zinc pounds sold, respectively. These measures are calculated on a consistent basis for the periods presented on a consolidated basis. Average realized price per ounce&#47; pound statistics are intended to provide additional information only, do not have any standardized meaning prescribed by GAAP and should not be considered in isolation or as a substitute for measures of performance prepared in accordance with GAAP. The measures are not necessarily indicative of operating profit or cash flow from operations as determined under GAAP. Other companies may calculate these measures differently.</font></div><div style="margin-top:12pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">The following tables reconcile these non-GAAP measures to the most directly comparable GAAP measure&#58;</font></div><div Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:11.97pt">For the three months ended June 30, 2024 the Company sold 39 thousand tonnes of copper, 20 thousand tonnes of lead, and 52 thousand tonnes of zinc.</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open
